info.description: The vCenter Server Appliance is a preconfigured Linux-based virtual machine optimized for running vCenter Server and associated services.
info.title: appliance

put.summary: Set enabled state of the console-based controlled CLI (TTY1).

get.summary: Get enabled state of the console-based controlled CLI (TTY1).

put.summary: Set enabled state of Direct Console User Interface (DCUI TTY2).

get.summary: Get enabled state of Direct Console User Interface (DCUI TTY2).

put.summary: Set enabled state of BASH, that is, access to BASH from within the controlled CLI.

get.summary: Get enabled state of BASH, that is, access to BASH from within the controlled CLI.

put.summary: Set enabled state of the SSH-based controlled CLI.

get.summary: Get enabled state of the SSH-based controlled CLI.
Get health status of applmgmt services.
Get database storage health.
Get load health.
Get memory health.

Get information on available software updates available in remote VUM repository. red indicates that security updates are available. orange indicates that non security updates are available. green indicates that there are no updates available. gray indicates that there was an error retreiving information on software updates.
Get storage health.
Get swap health.
Get overall health of system.
Get last check timestamp of the health of the system.
Get monitored items list
Get monitoring data.
Get monitored item info

post.summary: Add domain to DNS search domains.

get.summary: Get list of DNS search domains.

put.summary: Set the Fully Qualified Domain Name.

get.summary: Get the Fully Qualified Doman Name.

post.summary: Test the Fully Qualified Domain Name.

put.summary: Set the DNS server configuration. If you set the mode argument to "DHCP", a DHCP refresh is forced.

post.summary: Add a DNS server. This method fails if mode argument is "dhcp"

get.summary: Get DNS server configuration.

post.summary: Test if dns servers are reachable.

get.summary: Get list of available network interfaces, including those that are not yet configured.
Get information about a particular network interface.

post.summary: Initiate backup.

get.summary: Get list of backup jobs
See backup job progress/result.

post.summary: Cancel the backup job

get.summary: Get a list of the backup parts
Get size of the optional part

post.summary: Check for backup errors without starting backup.
Initiate restore.

get.summary: See restore job progress/result.

post.summary: Cancel the backup job
Get metadata before restore

get.summary: Get disk to partition mapping

post.summary: Resize all partitions to 100 percent of disk size

get.summary: Get system time.
Get the system uptime.
Get the version.

put.summary: Update local user account properties role, full name, enabled status and password

post.summary: Create a new local user account.

get.summary: List of local accounts
Get the local user account information.
Return an SNMP agent configuration.

post.summary: Stop an enabled SNMP agent.
Start a disabled SNMP agent.
Generate localized keys for secure SNMPv3 communications.

get.summary: Get SNMP limits information.

post.summary: Restore settings to factory defaults.

get.summary: Generate diagnostics report for snmp agent.

post.summary: Send a warmStart notification to all configured traps and inform destinations (see RFC 3418).

put.summary: Set list of inbound IP addresses to allow or deny by firewall. This replaces all existing rules. Firewall rules have no impact on closed ports because these ports are closed for all traffic.

post.summary: Add a firewall rule to allow or deny traffic from incoming IP address.

get.summary: Get ordered list of inbound IP addresses that are allowed or denied by firewall.

post.summary: Delete specific rule at a given position or delete all rules.

get.summary: Get IPv4 network configuration for all configured interfaces.

200.description: IPv4 configuration for each queried interface.

post.summary: Get IPv4 network configuration for interfaces.
Renew IPv4 network configuration on interfaces.  If the interface is configured to use DHCP for IP address assignment, the lease of the interface is renewed.

get.summary: Get IPv6 network configuration for all configured interfaces.

post.summary: Get IPv6 network configuration for interfaces.

put.summary: Set Proxy configuration. In order for this configuration to take effect a logout is required.

get.summary: Get proxy configuration for all protocols.

post.summary: Delete a Proxy configuration for a specific protocol.
Test a Proxy configuration by testing the connection to the proxy server and test host.

put.summary: Set static routing rules. A destination of 0.0.0.0 and prefix 0 (for IPv4) or destination of :: and prefix 0 (for IPv6) refers to the default gateway.

post.summary: Set static routing rules. A destination of 0.0.0.0 and prefix 0 (for IPv4) or destination of :: and prefix 0 (for IPv6) refers to the default gateway.

get.summary: Get main routing table. A destination of 0.0.0.0 and prefix 0 (for IPv4) or destination of :: and prefix 0 (for IPv6) refers to the default gateway.

post.summary: Delete static routing rules.
Test connection to a list of gateways

get.summary: Get the NTP configuration status. If you run the 'timesync.get' command, you can retrieve the current time synchronization method (NTP- or VMware Tools-based). The 'ntp' command always returns the NTP server information, even when the time synchronization mode is not set to NTP. If the time synchronization mode is not NTP-based, the NTP server status is displayed as down.

put.summary: Set NTP servers. This command deletes old NTP servers from the configuration and sets the input NTP servers in the configuration. If the time synchronization is NTP-based, the NTP daemon is restarted to reload the new NTP configuration. Otherwise, this command just replaces servers in the NTP configuration.

post.summary: Add NTP servers. This command adds NTP servers to the configuration. If the time synchronization is NTP-based, then NTP daemon is restarted to reload the new NTP servers. Otherwise, this command just adds servers to the NTP configuration.

Delete NTP servers. This command deletes NTP servers from the configuration. If the time synchronization mode is NTP-based, the NTP daemon is restarted to reload the new NTP configuration. Otherwise, this command just deletes servers from the NTP configuration.
Test the connection to a list of ntp servers.

get.summary: Get a list of all known services.

post.summary: Manage a service with arbitrary command and arguments.
start or restart a service
Get status of a service.
Stop a service

get.summary: Get details about the pending shutdown action.

post.summary: Cancel pending shutdown action.
Power off the appliance.
Reboot the appliance.

get.summary: Get update repository configuration.
Get time synchronization configuration.

200.description:
Map of service identifiers to service Info structures.
The key in the result map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.

400.description: if any error occurs during the execution of the operation.

get.summary: Lists details of services managed by vMon.

400.description:
if the operation is denied in the current state of the service. If a start, stop or restart operation is in progress, update operation will fail with this error.
if a request to set the Service.UpdateSpec.startup-type field of spec to DISABLED comes in for a service that is not in STOPPED state.

404.description: if the service associated with service does not exist.

parameters.description:
identifier of the service whose properties are being updated.
The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.
parameters.name: id

patch.summary: Updates the properties of a service.

400.description: if any other error occurs during the execution of the operation.

404.description: if the service associated with service does not exist.

identifier of the service whose state is being queried.
The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.
parameters.name: id

400.description: if any other error occurs during the execution of the operation.

404.description: if the service associated with service does not exist.

parameters.description:
identifier of the service to restart
The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.
parameters.name: id

400.description: if any other error occurs during the execution of the operation.

identifier of the service to start
The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.
parameters.name: id

400.description: if the operation is denied in the current state of the service. If a stop operation is in progress, issuing another stop operation will lead to this error.

404.description: if the service associated with service does not exist.

parameters.description:
identifier of the service to stop
The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.appliance.vmon.Service.
parameters.name: id

mode.description: Define how to determine the DNS servers. Leave the servers argument empty if the mode argument is "DHCP". Set the servers argument to a comma-separated list of DNS servers if the mode argument is "static". The DNS server are assigned from the specified list.

backup_password.description: a password for a backup piece The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space).

parts.description: a list of optional parts. Run backup parts APIs to get list of optional parts and description

start_time.description: Time when this backup was started.

end_time.description: Time when this backup was finished.

com.vmware.appliance.techpreview.monitor.description: {@name SNMPAuthProto} {@term enumerated type} Defines SNMP authentication protocols

users.description: Set up to five local users. The format is: user/-|auth-hash/-|priv-hash/model[,...]. Here user is maximum 32 characters long; '-' indicates no hash; model is one of none, auth or priv.

privacy.description: Set the default privacy protocol. Values: none or AES128.

loglevel.description: System Agent syslog logging level: debug|info|warning|error.

v3targets.description: Set up to three SNMPv3 notification targets. Format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/remote-user/security-level/trap|inform[,...].

notraps.description: Comma-separated list of trap OIDs (object identifiers) for traps not to be sent by the agent. Use 'reset' to clear the setting.

syslocation.description: System location string as presented in sysLocation.0. Up to 255 characters long.

port.description: Set up a UDP port which the SNMP agent uses to listen on for polling requests. The default UDP port is 161.

targets.description: Set up to three targets to which to send SNMPv1 traps. The format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/community[,...]. The default port is UDP 162. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

remoteusers.description: Set up to five inform user IDs. The format is: user/auth-proto/-|auth-hash/priv-proto/-|priv-hash/engine-id[,...]. Here, user must be maximum 32 characters long; auth-proto is none, MD5 or SHA1; priv-proto is none or AES; '-' indicates no hash; engine-id is a hexadecimal string '0x0-9a-f' and must be up to 32 characters long.

authentication.description: Set the default authentication protocol. Values can be none, MD5, or SHA1.

communities.description: Set up to ten communities, each of no more than 64 characters long. The format is: community1[,community2,...]. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

engineid.description: Set SNMPv3 engine ID. The engine ID must contain 5 to 32 hexadecimal characters. "0x" and colon (:) are removed from the ID.

syscontact.description: System contact string as presented in sysContact.0. Up to 255 characters long.

users.description: Set up to five local users.

loglevel.description: System Agent syslog logging level: debug|info|warning|error.

v3targets.description: Set up to three SNMPv3 notification targets. Format is: ip-or-hostname[@port]/remote-user/security-level/trap|inform[,...].

notraps.description: Comma-separated list of trap OIDs (object identifiers) for traps not to be sent by the agent. Use 'reset' to clear the setting.

syslocation.description: System location string as presented in sysLocation.0. Up to 255 characters long.

port.description: Set up a UDP port which the SNMP agent uses to listen on for polling requests. The default UDP port is 161.

targets.description: Set up to three targets to which to send SNMPv1 traps.

authentication.description: Set the default authentication protocol. Values can be none, MD5, or SHA1.

communities.description: Set up to ten communities, each of no more than 64 characters long. The format is: community1[,community2,...]. This setting overwrites any previous settings.

syscontact.description: System contact string as presented in sysContact.0. Up to 255 characters long.

auth_hash.description: Provide filename to secret for authentication hash, use in set --users (required secret)

raw_secret.description: Make --auth_path and --priv_path flags read raw secret from command line instead of file.

priv_hash.description: Provide filename to secret for privacy hash, use in set --users (secret)

max_trap_destinations_v1.description: Set up max trap destinations limit

usmstatsunknownengineids.description: No of usm stats unknown engine ids

com.vmware.appliance.techpreview.monitor.description: {@name SNMPv3Notfication} {@term enumerated type} Defines SNMP v3 notification types

position.description: Position before which to insert the rule (zero-based). If you try to insert the rule in a position whose number is greater than the number of rules, the firewall rule is inserted at the end of the list.

all.description: Delete all firewall rules. Set all argument to "true" to delete all rules or set the all argument to "false" to delete a single rule.

policy.description: The allow or deny policy of this rule.

prefix.description: CIDR prefix used to mask address. For example, an IPv4 prefix of 24 ignores the low-order 8 bits of address.

interface_name.description: The interface to which this rule applies.  An empty string or "*" indicates that the rule applies to all interfaces.

com.vmware.appliance.techpreview.network.description: {@name FirewallRulePolicy} {@term enumerated type} Defines firewall rule policies

pos.description: Position before which to insert the rule (zero-based). If you try to insert the rule in a position whose number is greater than the number of rules, the firewall rule is inserted at the end of the list.

default_gateway.description: IPv4 address of the default gateway. This default gateway value is used if the mode argument is set to "static" This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

prefix.description: IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example , 24.  See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion. Set this argument to 0 if the mode is "unconfigured" or "dhcp".

address.description: IPv4 address, for example, "10.20.80.191". Set this argument to an empty string "", if the mode is "unconfigured" or "dhcp".

default_gateway.description: IPv4 address of the default gateway. This default gateway value is used if the mode argument is set to "static" This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

updateable.description: This indicates if the network configuration can be updated for the interface.

prefix.description: IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example , 24.  See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion. Set this argument to 0 if the mode is "unconfigured" or "dhcp".

address.description: IPv4 address, for example, "10.20.80.191". Set this argument to an empty string "", if the mode is "unconfigured" or "dhcp".

default_gateway.description: Default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

autoconf.description: Address is assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

addresses.description: A list of all addresses assigned to this interface.  The origin field of each address determines how the address was assigned, for example, statically, by DHCP, SLAAC.

default_gateway.description: Default gateway. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

dhcp.description: Address assigned by a DHCP server.

com.vmware.appliance.vmon.service.state.description: The Service.State enumerated type defines valid Run State for services.

startup_type.description:
Startup Type
If unspecified, leaves value unchanged.

data.description:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

messages.description:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

data.description:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

messages.description:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

messages.description:

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

default_message.description: The value of this localizable string or message template in the {@code en_US} (English) locale.  If {@link #id} refers to a message template, the default message will contain the substituted arguments. This value can be used by clients that do not need to display strings and messages in the native language of the user.  It could also be used as a fallback if a client is unable to access the appropriate message catalog.

args.description: Arguments to be substituted into a message template.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the localizable string or message template.

This identifier is typically used to retrieve a locale-specific string or message template from a message catalog.
